results.title: Gabriel Gate Cooks for Everybody
results.brief_description: This video brings together all of Gabriel Gate’s “Good Food” segments from the ABC TV’s “Everybody” program. In each segment, he examines one particular food group, and provides some tasty and healthy recipes using those ingredients.

results.title: Gabbeh
results.creator_credit: Sanayeh Dasti, MK2 Productions, Khalil Daroudchi, Khalil Mahmoudi and Mohsen Makhmalbaf
results.brief_description: With “Gabbeh” Mohsen Makhmalbaf creates a romantic parable of universal resonance. A gabbeh is an Iranian carpet produced by the nomadic Ghashghai tribe of southern Iran. This episodic tale is framed with exquisite interludes on the colours of nature, painting each scene with landscapes and vistas of breathtaking beauty.

results.title: G.I.G.O.: garbage in, garbage out
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films, Michael Clarke and Peter De Normanville
results.brief_description: A film describing what computers will do and what they will not do, whether in controlling steel cutting, running a bank, making airline bookings or supervising a chemical plant.

results.title: G.I. Jane
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Ridley Scott, Roger Birnbaum, Demi Moore and Suzanne Todd
results.brief_description: Addressing the issue of whether women belong on the battlefield, Ridley Scott’s “G. I. Jane” stars a seriously buffed Demi Moore in the title role as an ambitious Lieutenant, keen to make it as a navy SEAL. Pitted against a ruthless commander (a pre-“Lord of the Rings” Viggo Mortensen) Jordan’s quest is damned by the corrupt presence of a female Senator, who must stage-manage the recruit’s failure for political gain. A fantastic premise is at times left aside for detailing of military training sequences that involve your standard “spit in your face and kick you when you are down” routines. Cast also includes Anne Bancroft, Jason Beghe.

results.title: G-B 40 driving unit
results.creator_credit: Big Six Film Unit and Edward Cook
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the Huwood Hudswell G-B 40 model mine conveyor unit driving both a top and bottom belt gate conveyor. The complete unit is seen working in a Midlands colliery illustrating that with the acute shortage of manpower existing in the British coal mining industry, equipment such as this is raising the output of each worker.

results.title: Future wave: Japan design
results.brief_description: This documentary explores, through example and personal reflection, the economics, aesthetics, personalities, and traditional spiritual links that translate so spectacularly into Japanese design.

results.title: Future urban form
results.brief_description: “Summary: attemps to describe, analyse and evaluate certain trends and future possibilities for urban form in britain. two trends are isolated upward extension outward growth. the processes that underlie these trends are the examined. the development of the lift being largely responsible for upward extension, while outward growth is largely associated with the railroad and car. the ideas of a number of visionaries are then examined”

results.title: Future shock
results.creator_credit: Metro Media Corporation and Alex Grasshoff
results.brief_description: Examines the current phenomenon of future shock, the condition which results from too much change too fast. Current technological developments are presented through interviews with scientists. The film echoes Alvin Toffler’s questioning of whether or not change is necessary, and if it is out of control.

results.title: Future looks rosy
results.brief_description: Looks at the problems of soil salinity due to erosion and poor agricultural practices. In cooperation with the Department of Conservation, Forests & Land, landholders are seeking solutions to the problem of land degradation.
